headline: Vietnamese Fresh Spring Rolls
description: These Vietnamese spring rolls with rice noodles, shrimp, lettuce, and fresh herbs are served with two delicious Asian-inspired sauces for dipping.

video.description: See how to make healthy spring rolls with shrimp.
video.name: Vietnamese Fresh Spring Rolls

name: Vietnamese Fresh Spring Rolls
recipeIngredient: 8 large cooked shrimp - peeled, deveined and cut in half

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil; stir in vermicelli pasta and return to a boil. Cook pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the pasta is tender yet firm to the bite, 3 to 5 minutes.

Fill a large bowl with warm water. Dip one wrapper into the hot water for 1 second to soften. Lay wrapper flat; place 2 shrimp halves in a row across the center, add some vermicelli, lettuce, mint, cilantro, and basil, leaving about 2 inches uncovered on each side. Fold uncovered sides inward, then tightly roll the wrapper, beginning at the end with lettuce. Repeat with remaining ingredients.
For the sauces: Mix water, lime juice, sugar, fish sauce, garlic, and chili sauce in a small bowl until well combined. Mix hoisin sauce and peanuts in a separate small bowl.
Serve rolled spring rolls with fish sauce and hoisin sauce mixtures.

review.reviewBody: 1st time I made these. Delicious I didn't have fish sauce but they were still amazing. The mint cilantro and basil made a huge tastebud blast! I also added a little coleslaw dry mix. It was nice for crunch.
A DELISH recipe. Amazing taste, texture. Took me longer than instructions said, but otherwise one of the best meals ever!
it was very delicious.. but i do think the rice paper takes finesse that I obviously didn't have.. This will take practice. but very tasty not pretty this round

These are soooo good and easy to make at any time. The first time I tried these was at a Thai restaurant, they are so fresh and low-calorie. I bought the rice paper wrappers at WALMART! They were in the "International" section. They had Thai chili sauce there too, it is sweet and spicy great for these rolls.
This is pretty good. You need to really roll the wrapper tight so it stays together when you eat it. Don’t over soak the wrapper. It will soften more as you fill it.
Fantastic! I wasn't going to eat it the night I made it but I had to do a taste test. I couldn't put the fork down and ate at least 2 servings as a taste test.

These were ok but I found very hard to roll. Someone said place the wrap on a paper towel…bad idea , it stuck to the paper towel! Tossed that one. Did not care for the fish sauce added to one of the dips. Used Hoisin sauce and peanut butter for the second one. Dipped in both was an unusual flavor, will try the sauces again.
Definitely a cheat, but I add one piece of thin-sliced, crisp-fried pancetta to each roll. The slight hit of salt and the evocation of roast pork (without the effort) works wonderfully.

OMG! I invited 2 other girlfriends over to help me make enough for a party and we had so much fun making these!!! We filled them and rolled them like burritos! We laughed so hard at our earlier attempts but this is so delicious you will want to share!! We made 24 of them and with 4 people all adults, this was a fine dinner!!
Great recipe. True tastes of Vietnam
These are very sticky after they are made. It makes them hard to eat when they stay sticky.
I love this recipe. The sauce with lemon and peanuts is so good. I didn't carefor the one with hoisin sauce. Followed the recipe. Will make again.
Delicious. I have made fresh spring rolls before this recipe so I added some julienne fresh ginger. Its a great dinner on those hot muggy days. Cool and fresh.
Easy to make and super tasty!
The taste was great but more of a fun thing to do occasionally. Sort of messy but I suppose doing it a few times could improve the necessary techniques. Sauces were excellent.
Loved it! Of course mine weren't as pretty as the picture!
This was excellent!!! I added some slivered carrots and daikon radish for extra crunch.
I have been using this recipe for years and it's my absolute favorite. It has eventually become a family favorite.
Super easy and delicious, made some with chicken and shrimp. I added carrots and onion for extra flavor would make these again and again...
Absolutely delicious. Very addictive and we cannot get enough. Thank you for a great recipe!!!
The fish sauce is easily the best I've even had. Lots of flavor.

We love this recipe and make it frequently. We do change it a little. Sometimes we use a bag of frozen asian vegetable mix and saute it with a Tbsp of sesame oil and a little tamari sauce. It's a great recipe, timewise and ease. Love it when I get home from work late and don't feel like cooking.
A really tasty and easy to assemble dish
I love the base recipe. I added carrots and cucumber. . It has a very fresh taste. I just need more practice rolling them
Adding cucumber,carrots and sprouts improved the recipe. Loved the fish sauce dip!! 2# shrimp (#21 size) made 24 rolls
These were OK. I made a mistake and purchased tapioca papers instead of rice - WAY TOO THIN. Also the hoisin dipping sauce was not good. There are a number of other peanut dipping sauces much better.

AH-MAZ-ING!! followed the recipe almost exactly. Instead of shrimp I grilled and sliced some pork. Not a fan of seafood. For the dipping sauce, I highly recommend using creamy peanut butter instead of chopped peanuts. Heat it over the stove with a little bit of water and delish! Tastes just like it does at my local restaraunt

Easy, once you get all the ingredients. This helped me learn about an Asian store in my town- what fun to walk those aisles and the variety of foods! Back to the recipe- they were yummy! My family loved them!

It was quite easy to find everything I needed at a small Asian market 10 minutes from my house. It was easy to make and delicious. I made a peanut sauce instead of the two sauces mentioned in the recipe. It complimented the rolls wonderfully!
This recipe was incredibly easy and the ingredients were relatively inexpensive. I didn't make the sauces described here, as I had several others on hand. The rolls were delicious!

Excellent. I made them according to the receipe and they came out delicious. It is an easy receipe to follow. Once you have set up all of the ingredients its easy to get the rolls wrapped. The mint, basil and cilantro ..amazing taste. A must, must, try.

First time making these, and actually turned out good. I don't like cilantro, but used it anyway. Should have chopped more herbs and lettuce, but turned out good enough. Made a Hoisin dip and the spicy fish sauce dip. And, no more than soaking rice wrappers longer than 5 seconds!! And set them on parchment paper as they were made.

Good recipe, but we put carrot shreds, cucumber and fresh bean spouts in generally, and serve them with peanut sauce. (I like those instead of the lettuce) Fresh Spring Rolls are a favorite birthday dinner choice with our big extended family!

It took me a couple of tries to nail the rice wrap, but after I got it down, man, these are SOOO good. Especially with the sauces provided to make with it. I took for tailgating to a concert and most everyone enjoyed. It does take time to make, but it's worth it!
Did not have peanuts. Delicious ! It will be one of my staples!

I put in very thinly sliced red peppers and carrots for crunch and served it with Thai sweet chili sauce as one of the dipping options. I also overcooked the vermicelli but it's a very forgiving and versatile recipe.
I really liked it, but added way too much mint. Will have to try it again.
The sauces aren't by favorite but the rolls were very good.
Delicious and easy. I subbed water chestnuts for the cucumber a reviewer advised to add. Other wise I followed the recipe and it was great!
Was delicious! For the sauce I did what others recommended and mixed my favorite peanut butter with hoisin sauce! It was refreshingly a nice light spring snack/meal.
These are so easy to make. My favorite filling is quick and simple: glass noodles, lettuce, cucumber, bell pepper, avocado, and shrimp.
Wonderful and easy to wrap.

Added carrots as other posters suggested. I also added broccoli. Put hoisin sauce right in each roll. This works well! Served alone. I ate 4 rolls to feel satisfied. I’m 5’2” and 125 lb. I hope this helps you calculate servings! Would be very good served with soup.
Really good!

YUMMY!!! I always order these when they are available and was thrilled to make them quickly, easily and very little cost (I do usually have all the Asian sauces etc on hand at my house). The sauces were also easy and super tasted!

Thank you for a great recipe!
It was great but kept falling apart
This recipe is a quick and easy appetizer/snack for anyone looking for a more healthy choice.
Just love it!!! It became my family's favorite.
Supper yummy spring rolls I would definitely add more basil and mint next time but they were so good and easy to make! Also the dipping sauce was just perfect!!
These are great! Love making this babies.
I love these! I leave out the shrimp.
I made it exactly according to the recipe and they were devoured immediately. I will DEFINITELY make them again
Added a lot more garlic (6 cloves) and it was perfect!
Great recipe, however video shows raw shrimp. Remember to use cooked shrimp as listed in recipe.
Great recipe, however video shows raw shrimp. Remember to use cooked shrimp as listed in recipe.
I added shredded carrots as well as shredded cucumbers along with thin rice pasta. Soo Yummy!

Very good!! But I doubled almost everything! Used way more shrimp and added cucumber , avocado, bean sprouts. For the sauce I followed the suggestions and made one part peanut butter, 2 parts hoisin sauce. Added sesame seeds, lime juice and a few squirts of sirachi !! Perfection!
Yummy!

I’ve made these many times as I cannot get these at any local restaurants in our small-ish community. At first I made strictly by the recipe and they are very good. This is an easy recipe to adjust to your tastes. I really like them with shrimp but have also used leftover rotisserie chicken, thinly sliced leftover rare beef, etc. I slice my veggies and meat first. Then I find that by bringing the water to a full boil b4 tossing in the rice noodles they cook almost instantly. I then strain them out, saving the hot water, and do a quick dip in cold water. Then plop them on a kitchen towel to dry a little more. I quickly dip the rice papers into the reserved hot water, lay it directly on the counter and fill/roll one at a time. With a little practice I’ve realized that less is best with filling them up and rolling tightly. I’ll make 4 just for a evening snack and use dumpling sauce or ginger dressing as a dip.
I love love love this dish, as well the peanut sauce! It's great for the summer!
Delicious and easy. Love these with Honey Peanut Asian Sauce!
it is HARD rolling those papers (but not the recipe fault, mine) as good as the favorite pho shop!~!
I am made exactly as directed and they were delicious! To save time after chopping the basil, cilantro,mint and lettuce, I combined them in one bowl prior to adding to the rolls.

I used both lettuce and cabbage because I wanted to add crunch. Added bean sprouts & thinly sliced carrots. I would also cut back on the water in the dipping sauce. Loved it. It’s so good. I’ve made it about three more times since I first posted a review.

Loved it. Don't forget the bean sprouts!

The sauces are great.
Crisp clean spring rolls. Will make again

These were awesome and the sauce was great. I added only half the amount of lime juice since it was already pretty tart. I also made a peanut dipping sauce which was just 1/4 cup peanut butter, 1/4 cup hoisin sauce and agave to taste (for sweetness and more liquid texture).
We're too uncoordinated to wrap it in the rice wrappers so we used bib lettuce. DELICIOUS! Great flavor with less work.
These turned out delicious and they were so simple...as long as you are careful with the rice wrappers.
I didn't add any of the fish/shrimp and it was great! I will definitely make this multiple times.

This was fun to make and tasted great! Next time I will omit the rice vermicelli. Changes : I included shredded carrots, increased the amount of shrimp, decreased the amount of cilantro, and I used the peanut butter/hoisin sauce recommended by the #1 positive reviewer...easy to do and was a hit!
I have made these a few times and they never disappoint.
So easy to make and so good!

This was excellent and the notes from the other ratings helped me a lot with putting it all together. I followed the recipe exactly with the exception of adding diced cucumber and diced avocado. I couldn’t find the basil required so I just omitted it. It was delicious but the sauces (or similar sauces) are a must, or it is bland. It is best served the same day, as I had some left over and the side with more layers got a little chewy as leftovers but that didn’t stop us from devouring them. I will make this again.

Follow the directions on the package for the rice vermicelli and rice wrappers. First sauce was gross so I added sugar until it tasted better then a splash of hot pepper oil mixed well then delicious. The spring rolls are worth the time but the directions are a bit off.
had a Vietnamese friend of mine try them. he told me to use Napa cabbage, bean sprouts and carrots. i will try that next. he did like them though
this is so good and everyone in our family loves this one.
Added blanched carrots. Liked how refreshing this was when paired with a spicier main dish.
Made for dinner. Too labor intensive for a weeknight. BUT everyone loved it.
Very good. Fun to let everyone roll their own. I used more shrimp. I think they also need something more for crunch.
This was so easy! Kids were thrilled.
I added shredded carrots to the filler and a smidge of ginger spread on the wrappers. Excellent flaboring.

Very Good. The peanut sauce was the best. I used almost the same amount of peanut butter and hoisin sauce, but more hoisin sauce along with some chopped up peanuts plus water and heated it for just a big. I would plan for 3 pieces of shrimp per roll. My only problem was I tried to put too much in. I used noodles, lettuce, basil, small chopped carrots.
Added julienned cucumber and carrots. I made a different peanut sauce though.
I add a bit of cooked pork and kani for more flavor. But this is already good as it is.

I tried my hand at Vietnamese spring rolls. This version is vegan and all rice paper and noodles. I substituted tofu for shrimp. I like cooked tofu and fried up a box - that was a mess. It took me this batch to figure out the workflow.
This was easy and taste great. Thanks for sharing!
Turned out well. I used plum sauce and hoisin with peanuts for dipping.
Almost as good as my favorite SE Asian restaurant! And not too too hard! Yum!
I do not think I will make this again. It came out quite poorly.

I'm sorry I have to give this a low rating. I love Asian food and I wanted to love this but it was just bland, bland, bland, even with all the herbs fresh from my garden. The rice paper was incredibly sticky and just impossible to eat without the whole thing falling apart. There must be a way to ameliorate the stickiness but neither the recipe nor the comments provided an answer. I can't recommend this recipe and I won't be making it again. I hope I can find another way to use up the rice paper.

I used only cilantro, shrimp, green onions and noodles and it turned out amazing. 

Turn out a quick peanut sauce using a small amount of the fish sauce, water, sweet chili sauce, peanut butter and crushed peanuts and a bit of fresh cracked pepper! It's really easy and makes for incredible dipping sauce for chicken satay as well.
Very authentic and easy to make!
Exactly like those you get at Pho Grand, in south St. Louis. We didn't care for the "thick" sauce. The thin sauce is DA BOMB!

My guests and I really enjoyed this recipe. I modified it by changing the vermicelli to cucumber to accommodate the needs of a diabetic and a guest on the Keto diet.

I will definitely make it again and would love recipes for oriental sauces that are sugar free.
Didn't like the rice paper used. Maybe I will fry it next time.
I will make it again, tomorrow Tuesday. I put more shrimp in it than it called for, and It was good!

Super simple and not too much work! I did add pork and avocado to mine. I will work harder on the wrappers next time to get them a little tighter and I will buy larger shrimp than I did. Great recipe!
We enjoyed making these spring rolls. We mixed it up a bit by adding chopped pistachios to the soy sauce.
